name: This Eerie Abandoned Island Is Hidden In The Bronx â€” And Itâ€™s Only A Ferry Ride Away From Manhattan

name: Discover The Forgotten Insane Asylum Beneath Columbia Universityâ€™s Campus
description: Whatâ€™s now a sprawling campus for higher learning, once stood a private hospital for the mentally ill. The Bloomingdale Insane Asylumopened in Morningside Heights in 1821 across 38-acres of the land Columbia University now sits atop. It was founded by a committee of the New York Hospital and looked after patients between the ages of 14 to 83, who either paid for their care or has costs subsidized by the state. Professor of historic preservation at the Graduate School of Architecture, Planning, and Preservation, Andrew Dolkart, and his book,Morningside Heights: A History of Its Architecture andDevelopmentnoted that â€œthe hospital governors and staffâ€¦were among thefirst medical professionals in America to seek the â€˜humaneâ€™ treatmentof those impacted by mental illness,â€ though historical patient anecdotes may disagree. The only other operating psych ward in the state at this time was the New York State Lunatic Asylum.

Conde Nast Travelerjust released their list of the 71 most beautiful streets in the world, and our very ownNYC made the listâ€“twice! The first New York city mention is in Brooklyn, specificallyDUMBO. Hereâ€™s what they had to say about it: For those who walk through the cobblestone street inBrooklynâ€™s Dumbo neighborhood, the sudden sight of Manhattan Bridge might come as a splendid surprise.

name: Floating, Lifelike â€˜Travelersâ€™ Are Taking Over Park Avenue
description: For the third rendition ofPatrons of Park Avenueâ€˜s (POPA) annual art installation along Park Avenue, comes â€œTravelersâ€ by French sculptor, Bruno Catalano. â€œTravelersâ€ is Catalanoâ€™s first major U. S. exhibition and itâ€™s absolutely remarkable. Commuters journeying along Park Avenue this spring will catch his fractured, figurative sculptures in the middle of their own journey from and to where we donâ€™t know.

name: NYers Walk Up To 3x As Much As The Average American Each Day
description: Weâ€™ve all heard that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends walking 10,000 steps daily, but is anyone really doing that? The people of New York sure do, let us tell you! According toMayo Clinic,the typical American averages anywhere from 3,000-4,000 steps per day. This equates to around one and a half to two miles per day. Yet, in a statistic from the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene,New Yorkers average between 6,000-10,000 steps per day.

name: You Wonâ€™t Believe This Enchanting Chinese Garden Is Actually In NYC
description: Did you know you can feel like youâ€™ve beentransported to a lush garden in China, right here in NYC? Snug Harbor Cultural Center and Botanical Gardenon Staten Islandis home toThe New York Chinese Scholarâ€™s Garden (NYCSG), one of only two â€œauthentic, classical outdoor Chinese gardensâ€ built in the U. S. And before you say that Staten Island is too far, Snug Harbor is right near the ferry terminal (just a 10-minute bus ride), so you can make a day of it! Reminder: the Staten Island Ferry is free to ride, has great views of the Statue of Liberty, and sells booze on board!

userId: Source / A Candlelight spring concert in NYC, one of the city's most popular events that is led by women.
name: Meet The Female Leaders Behind Some Of NYCâ€™s Most Dynamic Events
description: Thereâ€™s alwayssomething to do in NYCand we were lucky enough to speak to some of the mostinfluential womenbehind some of the hottest events in the city! Letâ€™s give some much deserved flowers to the achievements of women who make the city go round onthis International Womenâ€™s Day (March 8th). Enjoy learning from the female leaders who are often behind the curtains of these successful events, but work tirelessly to make them happen for New Yorkers and beyond. I started working on the Fever Originals team in September 2019 and had the opportunity to launch the Candlelight experience starting in the USA. We launched our first USA show inOctober 2019 in NYC, and Candlelight isnow present in over 100 citiesin the USA!

name: The Stunning Sheen Center Is A Creative Hub For Theatre, Music And Performance
description: The Sheen Center for Thought & Cultureis a stunning historical building that blendsGothic Revival style architecturelike intricate and ornate stone carvings with a modern style. The building has been around since themid-19th centurywhen it was home toSt. Alphonsus Church. Ever since itâ€™s played an important religious and secular role in the community. Becoming The Sheen Centre in 2015, it is a place that embraces and celebrates creativity, culture, faith, and contemporary thought with performances and much more.

name: The Tenement Museum Will Exhibit Its First-Ever Black Family Home
description: Lower East Sideâ€™s Tenement Museum has been recreating the apartments and retelling the stories behind the immigrant families who once resided nearby or within its walls. And for the first time ever, the museum will showcase a Black familyâ€™s story and home starting the week of Christmas. The exhibition titled,â€œA Union of Hope: 1869,â€will followBlack New Yorkers, Joseph and Rachel Moore. The pair spent their time in Lower Manhattan during the 1860s and 1870s. Joseph Moore was originally from New Jersey and his wife Rachel, from Kingston, New York, before they moved to a rear tenement in what is now considered SoHo.

name: Candlelight And Duracell Just Broke Global Records For The Most Candle-Lit Performance
description: If you were one of the lucky attendees of Candlelightâ€™s Vivaldi Four Seasons performance on November 10, you witnessed history in the making. The wildly popular concert series from Fever teamed up with Duracell to break itsglobal record for most candles, during a string quartet performance set to the enchanting glow of16,000 flameless candles. Thatâ€™s 3,000 more candles than Candlelightâ€™s previous record! Candlelightâ€™s monumental success would not be possible without the power of Duracell. The #1 Trusted Battery Brand proudly powers the breathtaking illumination Candlelight concerts are known for, bringing a magical ambiance to countless cities across the globe.

name: 10 Best Signs From The 2023 New York City Marathon
description: Around50,000 runners tackled the 26. 2-mile stretchacross the five boroughs at yesterdayâ€™s New York City marathon. Two course records were even smashed on Sunday: Catherine Debrunner (1:39:32, a course record in the womenâ€™s wheelchair divisions) and Tamirat Tola of Ethiopia (2:04:58, a course record in the menâ€™s open divisions). And though we canâ€™t credit the athletes enough, itâ€™s the thousands of spectators that made the spirit of the day truly tangible. Friends, family and supporters from around the world waited along the route to cheer on the runners with clapping, shouting, and our personal favorite,hysterical signs.

name: This 6-Acre â€˜Field of Lightâ€™ Will Illuminate New York City This December
description: Astunning light displaywill make its way to NYC onDecember 15th, 2023, turning more than 6-acres worth of Midtown East into the ultimate dreamlike oasis. Designed by world-renowned artist Bruce Munro, the installation, titledField of Light,features a breathtaking display of17,000 stemmed glass spheresthat will illuminate Manhattan. Field of Lightis set to take over the vacant site near the United Nations in Midtown East, stretching from38th to 41st Streets on First Avenue. The installation, which is meant toâ€œserve as a beacon of freedom and hope around the world,â€will feature lowlight fiber-optic spheres, which are solar-powered and will subtly change hues. London-born Munro is globally recognized forlarge-scale light-based artworksinspired by his lifelong study of natural light and curiosity about shared human experiences, and this installation is the epitome of that.

name: A Century-Old NYC Myth Gets Brought To Life Through A Sewer Alligator Sculpture
description: An old NYC legend claims thatalligators live in NYCâ€™s sewer system. The way the story goes is that wealthy New Yorkers would head to warmer states to vacation,bringing back baby alligators with them as souvenirs. Once the alligators grew too big to live in an NYC apartment however, they were flushed down the toilet to live, and ultimately reproduce, in the cityâ€™s sewer system. Of course the story has been denied by the city, but we all know how entertaining old legends can be. So itâ€™s no surprise that, to this day,whispers of the legend still find their way around New Yorkers.

userId: Source / Yoo Jean Han for Sothebyâ€™s International Realty
name: Hereâ€™s A Look Inside This Stunning $65M UES Gilded Age Mansion
description: On the Upper East Side near Fifth Avenue sits a stunning15,200-square-foot limestone mansion. The architecturally magnificent home, a testament to Manhattanâ€™s historic Gilded Age, is listed at a whopping $65 millionâ€“making it among a handful of themost expensive townhouses to ever be listed in NYC, according to6SqFt. Built in 1899 and sitting on a 15â€™ x 105â€™ swathe of land, themansionwasdesigned by original architect, C. P. H.

name: The Guggenheim Will Now Cost An Additional $5 To Visit
description: The Guggenheim is one of our fav spots to hit when strolling throughUpper East Side, but theyâ€™re now following suit with some of the cityâ€™s other museums and galleries andraising their admission price. According to theNY Times, theadmission price hike stems from a decline in museum membership. While membership was once a dependable source of income, itâ€™s actually fallen by nearly 16% in the last four years, with June attendance declining by 26%â€“from 89,600 to 65,900â€“over the same time period. And while attendance decreases, thecost of running the institution increases,whether that be heating the museum or shipping artworks. With the rise of admission fees anadult ticket to the Guggenheim will now cost $30rather than the previous $25.

name: View Over 30 NYC Galleries For Free This Week During The Chelsea Gallery Walk
description: Before the cityâ€™s galleries close for their annual summer breaks, thereâ€™s still time to immerse yourself in art and culture at some of the best that Chelsea galleries have to offer! The Art Dealers Association of America (ADAA) is hosting thefifth iteration of its annualChelsea Gallery Walkthis month, on Wednesday, July 19th. As part of this free, self-guided walk,galleries participating in the event will stay open late(until 8 p. m. ) for a rare opportunity for New Yorkers to get a glance at their exhibitions after-hours.

name: 10 Statues & Murals Honoring History-Changing Women Across NYC
description: International Womenâ€™s Day falls right in the middle ofWomenâ€™s History Month, making it the perfect time to reflect on the women who have played a pivotal role in our culture, whether fighting tirelessly for the rights we enjoy today or carving out paths for women to be fully and unabashedly themselves. Luckily, NYC gives you ample opportunity to do that, with statues, murals and other memorials highlighting incredible women and/or championing the power of women in general! Here are some of our favorites, with a map at the end as well to make them easier to find! This statue was unveiled in the summer of 2020â€¦and it was the first one ofrealwomen in Central Park, ever! Previous statues in the park that represented women were fictional beings, like Alice in Wonderland, Mother Goose, and Juliet (with Romeo).

name: 20 Things You Only Hear In NYC
description: Every place in the world has their own quirks and things that while totally normal there, may not be normal somewhere elseâ€“and the sounds you hear around you definitely play into this. We asked our followersto name some things they hear that let them know theyâ€™re in New Yorkâ€¦and here are some of the answers! (many more of which can be foundhere! )

userId: Source / Flower Flashes by Lewis Miller Design / Photo Credit: Leatal Cohen, Pic and Petal for L.E.A.F
name: A Massive Floral Festival Is Returning To Meatpacking This Weekend
description: After last yearâ€™s massive floral festival displaying one million vibrant blooms, the L. E. A. F Flower Show will return to the Meatpacking District for a second year. The festival will run this weekend,Friday,June 10th and Saturday, June 11th from 11a.

name: The Top 10 Most Filmed Streets In NYC
description: Weâ€™ve seen time and time again in movies and TV shows people moving to NYC to take a chance on their dream. In fact, NYC has been the backdrop on the big screen time and time againâ€”almost too many times to count! TheAmerican Home Shieldanalyzed data from IMDb to uncover the most filmed streets in the United States, and, while Californiaâ€™s Hollywood Boulevard takes the title for the Most Filmed Street in the U. S. out of 50 spots,NYC is home to 18 of those top 50.

name: Larger-Than-Life Animal Sculptures Are Taking Over NYC Streets
description: Husband-and-wife duo, Gillie and Marc, responsible for the massivegorilla sculpturethat took over Hudson Yards in 2020, is bringing a powerful new exhibit to NYC dedicated to the endangered species of the world. TitledFaces of the Wild, the four-month exhibit will feature nine, larger than life animal sculptures taking over NYC streets. Each piece tops out at 6-ft tall and depicts the faces of nine endangered species: the northern white rhino, chimpanzee, addax, western lowland gorilla, polar bear, red wolf, African forest elephant, hippopotamus, and the lion. Currently, there are over 32,000 species at risk of extinction, as a result of habitat loss, poaching, pollution, and climate change. The artists believe that â€œif we could see wild animals up close and get to know them as individuals, perhapsâ€¦we would not think twice about getting involvedâ€ to help reduce the planetâ€™s impending loss of biodiversity.

name: This Beautiful New Mural In The East Village Honors The â€˜Indomitable Spirit Of Ukraineâ€™
description: In NYCâ€™s own â€œLittle Ukraineâ€ in the East Village, a colorful mural has gone up to â€” designed by Ukrainians, for Ukrainians. Created by Brooklyn-based, Ukrainian-born artist Misha Tyutyunik, the large-scale piece was actually designedwiththe people of Kyiv when Tyutyunik completed his Fullbright program there in 2019, a press release shares. It was painted this past weekend by members of the neighborhood, who all came together to fill in the design with color, making it a full community effort. Entitled â€œUkraine: A History in Solidarity,â€ the work was inspired by the legendary story of Kyivâ€™s founding, involving siblings Kyi, Shchek, and Khoryv and Lybid. It depicts the famous monument of the three brothers and their sister, and â€œpersonifies Ukrainian storytelling and cultural history.

name: Step Onto A Spiderâ€™s Web Suspended 40 Feet In The Air At The Shed
description: The Shed has just debuted its largest exhibition in the U. S. to date and it will surely blow you away. TomÃ¡s Saraceno: Particular Matter(s)is taking visitors on a multi-sensory journey across 25,000 square feet. Complete with floating installations and interactive pieces, this exhibition calls for environmental justice and interspecies cohabitation.

name: 15 Of The Most Beautiful Subway Stations In New York City
description: Having aesthetically pleasing and architecturally impressive stops is important. No, it shouldnâ€™t come at the expense of timely trains and safe and functioning tracks, but appreciating one doesnâ€™t mean you have to excuse the other. So, weâ€™ve decided to highlight 15 of the most beautiful subway stations in New York City. Check them out below! The 34th Street Hudson Yards Station opened in 2018 and features beautiful glass mosaic artwork.

name: NYC Ranks Among The Top 10 Best Cities In The World For Dog Lovers
description: Everyone knows that all it takes to turn aruffday into a good one is a furry friend! And to many non-NYers surprise, NYC is actually ranked one of the top 10 best cities for dog lovers. The ranking was based off of astudydone by Protect My Paws, measuring cities by ratios of dogs to people, dogs per km2 (~0. 39 square miles), and the best dog facilities by collecting data from academic reports, the number of registered dogs (strays not included) and official government statistics. Out of 54 world cities studied,NYC came out at #10 for the best city in the world for dog lovers.

userId: Source / Courtesy of Noel Y. Calingasan â€¢ NYC (@nyclovesnyc)
name: Who Is Balto, The Bronze Siberian Husky In Central Park?
description: Standing tall and proud in Central Park, west of East Drive and 67th Street and north of the Tisch Childrenâ€™s Zoo, is a bronze hero, Balto. But who is Balto, and why was the monument created in the first place? According to Central Parkâ€™s website, in January 1925, Nome, Alaska was hit with a diphtheria outbreak. The only cure: an antitoxin, 674 miles away in Anchorage. A Siberian Husky named Balto, accompanied by a ferocious team of sled dogs, made national headlines as they traveled through a treacherous blizzard to Anchorage.

userId: Source / Van Gogh: Immersive Night with Gustav Klimt
name: These Captivating Monet & Klimt Exhibitions Are Coming To NYC For A Limited Time
description: Earlier this year,Van Gogh: The Immersive Experiencemade its NY debutat Skylight on Vesey in FiDi. Now, bothGustav Klimt and Claude Monet will join Vincent Van Gogh, and their artworks will be metamorphized into an epic immersive experienceat the majestic NYC building right in the heart of Lower Manhattan. The two artists will take over the Van Gogh exhibition on separate nights, withVan Gogh: Immersive Night with Claude Monettaking placethis Friday, December 17,Thursday, December 23,andWednesday, December 29, whileVan Gogh: Immersive Night with Gustav Klimttaking place thisSaturday, December 18,Wednesday, December 22, andMonday, December 27. Expect digital displays, dreamy sound effects, projection mapping, and so much more! Youâ€™ll be able to takean awe-inspiring journey into the incomparable universe of Van Gogh, one of the greatest artistic geniuses of the 19th century.

name: You Can Stay In Carrie Bradshawâ€™s Fabulously Recreated UES Apartment This Month
description: Anyone whoâ€™s watched the iconic NY showSex & The Cityhas definitely thought that to themselves at one point or another. And now, wellâ€¦you actually can! An apartmentexactlylike Carrieâ€™s in fact. Although you canâ€™t live in it full-time, you can pretend youâ€™re SATCâ€™s favorite writer forone night this November. To celebrate the upcomingnew reboot seasonâ€œAnd Just Like Thatâ€ & SATCâ€™s 23rd anniversary, Airbnb is teaming up with Sarah Jessica Parker to offer New Yorkers (and visitors) a once-in-a-lifetime stay in the heart of Manhattan.

name: A Seven-Foot-Tall Medusa Statue Has Appeared Across From The NYC Courthouse
description: A seven-foot-tall bronze Medusa statue has popped up atCentre St. in Lower Manhattanâ€” right across from the NYC County Criminal Court. Erected by the Medusa With The Head (MWTH) Project and the NYC Parksâ€™ Art in the Parks program, the statue â€œinverts the narrative of Medusa, portraying her in a moment of somberly empowered self-defense. â€ According to Ovidâ€™s epic Latin poem Metamorphosis, Medusa was famously hunted down and beheaded by Perseus, after she was cast out of the kingdom as a monster for being raped by King Poseidon. In the sculpture, she defends herself against her oppressor and beheads him instead.

name: Andrew Lloyd Webberâ€™s Legendary â€˜Phantom Of The Operaâ€™ Is Streaming For Free Right Now
description: Well we can help fill that theater void a littleâ€¦Andrew Lloyd Webberâ€™s iconic musical â€œThe Phantom of the Operaâ€ (which coincidentally ran on Broadway for 32 years) is streaming for free on YouTube for the next 48 hours! Starting at 2pm EST today, Oct. 9, that is. The YouTube channel thatappeared during the pandemicwhen we were all still quarantined at home, calledThe Show Must Go On, is coming back for anencore, if you will. The channel streamed a series of legendary Andrew Lloyd Webber musicals for no cost at all, fromJoseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, toJesus Christ Superstar, toCats.

name: A Lace Collar Has Appeared On Wall Streetâ€™s Fearless Girl Statue As A Way To Honor RBG
description: That statue would be â€œFearless Girl,â€ which first appeared in 2017 as an International Womenâ€™s Day art installation to help â€œcall attention to the lack of gender diversity on important corporate boards. â€ It was meant to be a temporary exhibit, but now has a permanent spot facing the New York Stock Exchange on Broad St. , in a bold stance with her hands on her hips. Sometimes she is outfitted with something topical (she could be seenwearing a face maskearlier this year), and this week appeared with a white, lace collar, in memory of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg who passed away on Friday. Gisburg and fellow Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day Oâ€™Connor added the collars as theonly womenon the Supreme Court, as the previous robes were made for men so the top of their collared shirts and ties could be seen.

name: Giant Face Masks Have Appeared On The Rockefeller Center Statues
description: Earlier this morning, many of the famous statues that sit in Rockefeller Center were all fitted with face masks (which must be quite large to cover the giant statuesâ€™ mouths! ). The clever surprise was part of an initiative from nonprofit Association for a Better NY and commercial real estate company Tishman Speyer, as a quirky way to helpwelcome New Yorkers intoPhase 2 of reopening. View this post on Instagram They cover: the golden Prometheus statue that sits above the iconic ice skating rink, the Mankind Figures (Maiden and Youth), sitting on either side of Prometheus, and the Atlas statue, which sits in the International Buildingâ€™s courtyard across Fifth Avenue from St. Patrickâ€™s Cathedral.

name: This Beautiful Austrian Lake Turns Into An Underwater Park Every Summer
description: Or rather, a mysterious underwater park in the Austrian mountains? The beautiful GrÃ¼ner See, which lies at the foot of the Styria Hochschwab mountains, is one of the most stunning lakes in Austria. But thatâ€™s not its only unique selling point. Every summer, the lake overflows with water thanks t0 melting snow from the surrounding mountainsâ€”gifting us with this unusual natural phenomenon. View this post on Instagram At exactly the same time each year, in May, the lake is in engulfed in water, filling to seven times its original depth.

name: The Empire State Building Will Shine Red For â€˜Heartbeat Of Americaâ€™ Every Night Through COVID-19 Battle
description: The building managers just shared that they have a new plan for lighting up the tower every evening, one that pays respects to the entire country as well as all of the medical workers fighting coronavirus every single day. â€œWeâ€™ll never stop shining for you,â€ they wroteon social media. â€œStarting tonight [March 30] through the COVID-19 battle, our signature white lights will be replaced by theheartbeat of Americawith awhite and red siren in the mastfor heroic emergency workers on the front line of the fight. â€ This is in addition to the brand music-to-light show that takes place every night at 9pm, synched to â€œEmpire State of Mind. â€ They synch it withZ100 and iHeartRadio.

name: NYC Now Has A Roller Disco Brunch Party Straight Out Of An 80s Dream
description: The Roller Disco Brunch Partywill be popping up at different venues across the city (with the first few being at Brooklynâ€™s well-known Schimanski! ) with an 80s-themed experience thatâ€™ll bring together the best of roller skating, retro disco, food and drinks. These epic skate parties are so much more than just your typical Sunday brunch where you sit around with friends eating and drinking. Here youâ€™ll be able to also hit the dance floor on skates and have some old-school fun with plenty of of live entertainment, special performances by professional roller dancers, a DJ, and (of course) brunching. Oh, and for those looking to go all outâ€¦dressing in the 80s-theme is encouraged (although not required).

userId: Source / Museum of the City of New York. Museum purchase, 2019.5.2
name: This Stunning New Photo Exhibit Shows Only-In-New-York Moments Through NYC History
description: The exhibit is a curated collection of pieces of art and objects from the permanent collection of the Upper East Side museum, that â€œilluminate the compelling and layered identity of New York and its stories. â€ Some pieces date all the way back to the colonial era while others hail from the very recent past. From precious candids of New Yorkers to views of NYC streets from another era, youneedto take a peek at the treasures of this very special city! John Lennon and Yoko Ono in front of the Dakota, New York, 1980 by Allan Tannenbaum, gelatin silver print. Empire on Mirror, 1998 by Kenji Nakahashi, chromogenic development print.

name: You Can Now Ride On These Giant Light-Up Seesaws On Broadway
description: The block has been closed off to traffic by the NYC DOT so you can fully embrace your inner child at the interactive art installation, called â€œImpulse. â€ The exhibit is put together by The Garment District Alliance and the seesaws were designed by Lateral Office and CS Design. Youâ€™ll need a buddy to balance out the other end (doesnâ€™t that just conjure upwonderfulmemories of being flung off the side in elementary school? ). As you both climb on, the seesaws will light up and play music, creating your own personal winter light show.

name: Naked Shakespeare In The Park Returns This August With An All New Show
description: TheTorn Out Theaterproduction company is definitely one of a kind when it comes to their renditions of classic plays from history. Although theyâ€™re fairly knew to the performing arts genre, their risquÃ© versions of Hamlet, The Tempest and The Rover at the annual Music Pagoda in Prospect Park, have consistently been met with large crowds intrigued to see what theyâ€™ve come up with next. If you havenâ€™t put two and two together, the â€œrisky-nessâ€™ comes from the actors playing their roles in the nude (so body-posi! ). Returning for its fourth all nude production, Torn Out Theater is combining some of the most popular scenes from the aforementioned productions above, as well as new material from Shakespearean plays:The Taming of the ShrewandRichard III.

name: New Exhibit Will Display Cherâ€™s Iconic Outfits At The Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: The display will be part of the Metâ€™s spring exhibit â€œCamp: Notes on Fashion,â€ and will coincide with this yearâ€™s MetGala theme which is also â€œCamp. â€ Both this yearâ€™s theme and spring exhibit were highly influenced by Susan Sontagâ€™s 1964 essayNotes on â€œCampâ€â€”which analyzes the notion of high art in excess within popular cultureâ€”and as themuseum puts it, â€œprovides the framework for the exhibition, which will examine how fashion designers have used their mÃ©tier as a vehicle to engage with camp in a myriad of compelling, humorous, and sometimes incongruous ways. â€ Although news of the exhibit has been known, it was not until a recent interview withFashionistathat more information was made known by fashion designer Bob Mackie. In his interview, he mentions that he lent a few of Cherâ€™s original costumes to the Met for this particular exhibit. Beyond being a fashion designer, Bob Mackie was also the costume designer forThe Cher ShowBroadway musical.

name: New Yorkers Are Obsessed With Wearing Black, This Is Why
description: No, New Yorkers donâ€™t dress in black because theyâ€™re in mourning of all their free time lost at the office, (although that may play a part of it). According to theNew York Times, New Yorkers became associated with wearing black during the 70s and 80s when different â€œfashion tribesâ€ began experimenting with different styles. Not only were artists, and edgier groups of people downtown dressing in black, but business people from uptown were also sporting the monochrome look. And yes, in comparison to other fashion metropolisâ€™ like Paris and Milan, New Yorkers really do wear more black. At fashion shows, says Valerie Steel, the director of theMuseum at FIT, New Yorkers popularize the idea that New York=black.

name: Adorable Puppy Mosaics Take Over The 23rd Street Subway Station
description: The mural mosaics can be seen on the F/M train line at the station on 23rd Street and Sixth Avenue. American artist William Wegman created â€œeleven glass mosaic panels of his famed Weimaraner portraitsâ€ which feature bright, uplifting colors to help brighten the spirits of commuting New Yorkers. In each image Wegman gives his dog human-like attributes where his pup is wearing fun coats and shirts, and in a statement said, â€œI wanted to create portraits of individual characters, people who you might see next to you on the platform. For these I dressed the dogs in more or less ordinary clothes, nothing too fashionable. I was very interested in the way in which photographs, even the out of focus dogs in the background of some images, could be translated into mosaic by Mayer of Munich, who skillfully turned grey stones into grey dogs.

name: This Interactive Cartoon â€œReality To Ideaâ€ Expo Is Coming To New York
description: Joshua Vides has been making waves in the art scene over the past year with his keen ability to take real life 3D objects and reverse them into their 2D sketch, or so it seems. Using simple black and white paint, Vides takes a random object or even a room and turns it totally cartoonish. HisInstagram accountis a collection of Air Jordans, traffic cones, fruits and other inanimate objects that have been transformed into a cartoon on par of thatevil doodleepisode of Spongebob (come on you totally know what Iâ€™m talking about). 10 days and counting . I need the whole city to pull up to @realitytoidea .

name: 14 Times The New York Subway Was Hollywoodâ€™s Biggest Star
description: The subway effects all of our lives. More often than not, not in the most positive of ways. As thousands upon thousands of people travel its trains and tunnels, an argument can be made that the NYC subway is the MOST visited of the cityâ€™s landmarks. With that said, itâ€™s only natural that Hollywood would capitalize on the fame of our subway as a backdrop for drama, romance, and comedy. Weâ€™ve put together a list of the most iconic scenes in cinema that feature our infamous subway.

name: A Snapchat Filter is Brining Jeff Koons Work To Life In Central Park
description: The artist behind theBalloon-Dog sculptureand theseated Balerinaat the Rockefeller Center has teamed up with Snapchat to bring his sculptures to life in Central Park. We love Jeff Koons in NYC. Even if you donâ€™t know him, you know his work. His most recent installation,the seated Ballerina at the Rockefeller Centerwas so embraced by locals and tourists it was allowed to stick around longer than scheduled. The artist behind balloon-dog and the beloved Balerina sculpture has developed a â€œlensâ€ for Snapchat that allows you to see one of his pieces in one of nine select locations around the world.

name: Check Out The Epic Free Summer Movie Schedule At Brooklynâ€™s Habana Outpost!
description: If there is one outdoor summer movie schedule to watch, itâ€™s the one at Habana Outpost. They are rolling out some of the greatest movies of all time, and youâ€™re invited. Fort Greeneâ€™sHabana Outposton 757 Fulton Street is screening movies that can be best described as a cinephileâ€™s wet dream. You wonâ€™t want to miss some of the pre-millennium greats that they have lined up for this years cine-fest. It also seems like theyâ€™ve gone out of their way to include some new york classics, likeThe Warriors,Do The Right Thing,Dead Presidentsand, Coming To America.
